From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

French

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Inherited from Middle French valoir, from Old French valoir, valeir, from Latin valēre, from Proto-Italic *walēō, from Proto-Indo-European *h₂wl̥h₁éh₁yeti, from *h₂welh₁- (“to rule, be strong”).

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /va.lwaʁ/
  • Audio:(file)
  • Audio (Canada (Shawinigan)):(file)
  • Audio (France (Lyon)):(file)
  • Audio (France (Somain)):(file)
  • Rhymes: -waʁ

Verb

[edit]

valoir

  1. (transitive) to be worth
    Selon leur mère, une femme vaut deux hommes.
    According to their mother, a woman is worth two men.
    • 2003, Carla Bruni, Quelqu'un m'a dit:
      On me dit que nos vies ne valent pas grand-chose ; elles passent en un instant comme fanent les roses.
      Someone told me our lives aren't worth much; they pass in an instant like roses wither.
  2. (transitive) to earn, to win, to bring (something of value, ironic usage notwithstanding)
    Qu'est-ce qui nous vaut la visite indési—euh, inopinée ?
    To what do we owe this unwant— erm, unexpected visit?
  3. (transitive, mathematics) to be equal to
    Une année-lumière vaut donc approximativement 63 241 [soixante-trois-mille-deux-cent-quarante-et-une] unités astronomiques.
    One light year is equal to approximately 63,241 astronomical units.
  4. (reflexive) to be the same, to have no difference between

1 The French gerund is usable only with the preposition en.
2 In less formal writing or speech, these tenses may be found to have been replaced in the following way:
past historic → present perfect
past anterior → pluperfect
imperfect subjunctive → present subjunctive
pluperfect subjunctive → past subjunctive

(Christopher Kendris [1995], Master the Basics: French, pp. 77, 78, 79, 81).

Derived terms

[edit]
  • deux avis valent mieux qu'un
  • deux précautions valent mieux qu'une
  • donner et retenir ne vaut
  • faire valoir
  • faire-valoir
  • le jeu n'en vaut pas la chandelle
  • mieux vaut prévenir que guérir
  • mieux vaut tard que jamais
  • ne rien dire qui vaille
  • un homme averti en vaut deux
  • un tiens vaut mieux que deux tu l'auras
  • une image vaut mille mots
  • vaille que vaille
  • valoir la peine
  • valoir le détour
  • valoir mieux
  • valoir son pesant d'or

Related terms

[edit]
  • en valoir la peine
  • vaillant
  • valence
  • valeur
  • valide
  • valoir mieux
  • valoriser

Further reading

[edit]
  • “valoir”, in Trésor de la langue française informatisé [Digitized Treasury of the French Language], 2012.

Middle French

[edit]

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • valloir (less common)

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin valēre.

Verb

[edit]

valoir

  1. to be worth; to have a certain value
  2. (of a person) to have merit; to be have positive qualities

Descendants

[edit]
  • French: valoir

References

[edit]
  • valoir on Dictionnaire du Moyen Français (1330–1500) (in French)

Old French

[edit]

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • valeir

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin valēre.

Verb

[edit]

valoir

  1. to have value; to be worth
    • c. 1170, Chrétien de Troyes, Érec et Énide:
      Qui plus de çant mars d'arjant vaut
      Which is worth more than 100 marks of silver

Conjugation

[edit]

This verb conjugates as a third-group verb. This verb has irregularities in its conjugation. Old French conjugation varies significantly by date and by region. The following conjugation should be treated as a guide.

    Conjugation of valoir (see also Appendix:Old French verbs)
simple compound
infinitive valoir avoir valu
gerund en valant gerund of avoir + past participle
present participle valant
past participle valu
person singular plural
first second third first second third
indicative jo tu il nos vos il
simple
tenses 		present vail, val vaus vaut valons, vaillons valez, vailliez valent, vaillent
imperfect valoie, valeie valoies, valeies valoit, valeit valiiens, valiens valiiez, valiez valoient, valeient
preterite valui, vaus valus, vausis valu, vaust valumes, vausimes valustes, vausistes valurent, vaustrent
future vaudrai vaudras vaudra vaudrons vaudroiz, vaudreiz, vaudrez vaudront
conditional vaudroie, vaudreie vaudroies, vaudreies vaudroit, vaudreit vaudriiens, vaudriens vaudriiez, vaudriez vaudroient, vaudreient
compound
tenses 		present perfect present tense of avoir + past participle
pluperfect imperfect tense of avoir + past participle
past anterior preterite tense of avoir + past participle
future perfect future tense of avoir + past participle
conditional perfect conditional tense of avoir + past participle
subjunctive que jo que tu qu’il que nos que vos qu’il
simple
tenses 		present vaille vailles vaille vailliens, vaillons vailliez vaillent
imperfect valusse, vausisse valusses, vausisses valust, vausist valussons, valussiens, vausissons, vausissiens valussoiz, valussez, valussiez, vausissoiz, vausissez, vausissiez valussent, vausissent
compound
tenses 		past present subjunctive of avoir + past participle
pluperfect imperfect subjunctive of avoir + past participle
imperative – tu – nos vos –
— — — — — —

Derived terms

[edit]
  • vaillant

Descendants

[edit]
  • Middle French: valoir
    • French: valoir
  • Norman: valeir, vaussir (from unattested *valsir from the past tense forms)
  • Walloon: valeur
  • → Middle English: availen (< a (“to”) + vail)
    • English: avail
    • Scots: avail, avale
